column4: Does wpa_supplicant need to be running as a daemon in order to start wpa_cli ?
yes , i beleive so
How do I "start" wpa_supplicant? When I issue a wpa_supplicant -Dwext -ieth1 -c/etc/wpa_supplicant.conf   and then start wpa_cli it says that is unable to connect to wpa_supplicant
pastebin your /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf file
http://pastebin.ca/index.php
it's empty
Uh wooops one sec
http://pastebin.ca/1796443
that link isn't working either
http://pastebin.ca/1796443 Works for me
I can upload it elsewhere if it's not working
ok got it ..try : sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
Well now even the ethernet card lost its connection :P
And wpa_cli still cannot connect to wpa_Supplicant
ok run sudo dhclient eth0 , to reconnect your wired/ethernet
Yeah already did that.
But the original problem remains.
what does wpa_cli have to do with wpa_supplicant?
Uhh have you ever run wpa_cli before?
Okay well perhaps that question is just about as useful as the question 'Why does wpa_cli say that it failed to connect to wpa_Supplicant" ?
failed to read or failed to connect ?
Could not connect to wpa_supplicant - re-trying
what command is creating that output in the terminal ?
wpa_cli
